msContents.summary: This is an account of the life (carittiram) of Jesuit missionary, martyr and saint João de Brito (1647-1693), also known by his Tamil name of Aruḷāṉanta Cuvāmi. The story is told by one of Brito's disciples, and a witness of his martyrdom, called Aruḷāṉantaṉ.

msItem.title: Vētacāṭciyāṉa rācariṣi aruḷāṉantacuvāmi tivviya vētattukkāka maṟavaṉ cīrmaiyil piṭipaṭṭup pāṭuppaṭṭa avaruṭaiya carittiram
msItem.author: Aruḷāṉantaṉ

filiation.p: This manuscript is the only copy of the text currently available to us; even though in his catalogue, Julien Vinson (BnF Indien 577, <ref target="https://gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b105375868/f229.item">folio 107r</ref>) mentions that the text has been printed by the Mission Press in Pondicherry in 1858.

msItem.incipit:
<note xml:lang="en">This is the preface, which comes immediately before the text and was written by the author himself:</note>
<milestone n="1r" unit="folio" facs="3"/> <lb n="1"/>vētacāṭciyāṉa rācariṣi aruḷāṉantacuvāmi tivviyavētattukkāka maṟavaṉ cīrmaiyil piṭipaṭṭup pā<lb n="2"/>ṭupaṭṭa avaruṭaiya carittiram caṟuvēcuraṉukku sttōttiramuṇṭākavum tirucapaiyākiya kiṟīsttuvar<lb n="3"/>kaḷ yāvarum aṟintu tēvavicuvācapattinampikkaiyil ttiṭapaṭavum aruḷāṉantaṉ yeḻutikiṟēṉ<pc>.</pc> <lb n="4"/>nāṉ piṟanta eṭṭāṉāḷ yinta vētacāṭciyāṉa kuruvāṉavar tammuṭaiya pēriṭṭu ñāṉasnāṉaṅ kuṭuttu pettata<lb n="5"/>kappaṉaip pōlē vicārittu yeṉṉai vaḷattār paṭippittār. piṟapāṭu ttiruccapaik kāriyamāka cintu
<pb n="1v" facs="4"/> <lb n="1"/>rāṭciya viṭṭu ṟōmāpurikkup payaṉam āy kappaleṟu cīrmaikkup pōy maṟupaṭi tēvavutaviyāl cci<lb n="2"/>nturāṭciyattukku vantu cēntavuṭaṉē yentakappaṉ naṉṟi yaṟintavaṉāy yeṉṉai yaḻaittuk koṇṭu pōy <lb n="3"/>avar pātattil tūyam paṇṇaccolli kkaṭṭaḷai yiṭṭoppivittar<pc>.</pc> anta ṉāḷ mutal koṇṭu avaruṭaiya pātattil avaru<lb n="4"/>kkup pūcaikkutavi ceytu koṇṭu kaṭṭaḷai yiṭṭa maṟṟavūḻiyamuñ ceytavarai viṭṭup piṟiyāmal iruntēṉ<pc>.</pc> ippaṭi yi<lb n="5"/>rukkiṟa pōtu maṟavaṉcīrmaiyil anta cīrmaikkuṭaiya rekuṉātatēvaṉ tivviyavētattukku virōtiyā
<pb n="2r" facs="5"/> <lb n="1"/>y iruntatiṉālē avaraip piṭikkiṟa pōtu ṉāṉ kūṭap piṭipaṭṭ avarōṭē kūṭa ciṟaicālaiyilē yiruntapaṭiyi<lb n="2"/>ṉālē avar aṉupavitta kasttina vātai yavamāṉam aṭi niṟpantam itu mutalāṉa turitaṅkaḷai yaṉupavittu kaṭaciyāy avar <lb n="3"/>vētacāṭciyāṉa carittira meyākavē kūṭa yiruntēṉ kaṇṇāka kaṇṭēṉ aṟintēṉ<pc>.</pc> ippō naṭanta carittiram caṟuvēcuraṉukku stōttiramuṇṭāka yeḻutikiṟēṉ<pc>.</pc>

<note xml:lang="en">This is the beginning of the main text:</note>
<milestone n="2r" unit="folio" facs="5"/> <lb n="5"/> caṟuvēcuraṉukku sttōttiramāka vētacāṭciyāṉa aruḷāṉantaracariṣikurucuvāmiyavarkaḷ yīntiyav eṉkiṟa
<pb n="2v" facs="6"/> <lb n="1"/>cintutēcattil uḷḷa āṟṟumākkaḷai reṭcikka vēṇum eṉṟu tāṟ piṟiyamāyc collappaṭāta ācaiyōṭē <lb n="2"/>cīrmai viṭṭu kappalēṟu cintu rāṭciyattukku yeruntaruḷi vantu yēṟakkuṟaiya iruvatu iruvattireṇṭu varuṣam pāṇ <lb n="3" break="no"/>ṭiṉāṭu cōḻaṉāṭu cēraṉāṭu yitu mutalāṉa tēcaṅkaḷilē tirintu caṟuvēcuraṉuṭaiya cattiyamāṉa ñāṉayupatēca <lb n="2"/><gap reason="ellipsis"/>
msItem.explicit: <milestone n="44r" unit="folio" facs="89"/> <lb n="3"/> <gap reason="ellipsis"/>ceṣṭarāṉa cuvāmi yavarkaḷ anta vētacāṭciyuṭaiya carīrattai yeṭukkiṟatu maṟavaṉ cīrmaik <lb n="4" break="no"/>k aṭuttāppōlē yoru vūrilē pōyiruntu koṇṭu atukkāṉa maṉuṣaraiyun tammuṭaiya cīṣarkkaḷaiyum aṉuppi ya <lb n="5" break="no"/>nta vētacāṭciyuṭaiya ciracum avaruṭaiya a<sic>pai</sic>yavaṅkaḷil cciṟitapaiyavaṅkaḷum akappaṭṭu atukkāṉa pucciyattuṭaṉē ce <lb n="6" break="no"/>ṣṭariṭamākac cerntutu avar atai makāppucciyamāka mutti ceytācāram paṇṇi kenta vaṟakaṅkaḷaip puciyatukkāṉa stala <lb n="7" break="no"/>ttilē koṇṭu pōy stāpittu vaitt irukkut eṉṟ aṟiyavum<pc>.</pc>

collation.desc: The front cover had a sticker of the BnF with the current classification (Indien 469). The back cover has on the inside some numbers in white chals : 53 bis 45-28.
The manuscript is fairly simple and is constitute by only one unit containing the text.

supportDesc.foliation: Folia are numbered as 1-44 with Tamil numbers, likely put by the original scribe, on the left margin.

handNote.desc: This scribe copied fols. 1-10v with the sole exception of the last line (l. 5) of <locus facs="22">folio 10v</locus>.
This scribe copied the last line of <locus facs="22">folio 10v</locus>, and folios 11-44v. The letters have sharper angles and the writing is inclined towards the right.
